document.docAuthor: Heleodoro, Raphael Aquino & Rafael, Jose Albertino
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Dinelytron Gray (Prisopodidae: Prisopodinae: Prisopodini), with a phylogenetic analysis of the genera of the Prisopodini, including the description of a new genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Dinelytron Gray (Prisopodidae: Prisopodinae: Prisopodini), with a phylogenetic analysis of the genera of the Prisopodini, including the description of a new genus

bibRefCitation.author: Gray, R.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gray, R., 1835. Synopsis of Phasmidae. Taylor e Francis, London, p. 27.
bibRefCitation.title: Synopsis of Phasmidae

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species
:
D. grylloides Gray, 1835
by subsequent designation of Kirby (1904) .

Legs. All legs with black spot at level of femuro-tibial articulation. Anterior femur at least 3.5 times longer than wide, with setae at anterior and posterior margins (8B; 11B; 49H). First tarsomere 1.5 times longer than second tarsomere. Mid and posterior leg dorsally and ventrally with setae. Mid leg shorter than remaining legs. Posterior femur ventrally with undulations or spines, better observed posterolaterally.

Abdomen. Elongated, slender, widening at tergum 7 towards apex ( Figs. 9A ; 12A and 15A) Vomer “V” shaped, wide at base and narrowing towards apex ( Figs. 9B ; 12C; 15C; 18B; 21B; 24B and 26B). Thorn pads semi-ellipsoid, with three to six spines ( Figs. 9B ; 12C; 15C; 18B; 21B and 24B). Subgenital plate not reaching tergum 10.
Examined female material .
Dinelytron sp.1: “RNVP 01”, “Linhares-ES [ Espírito Santo ], Brasil , 17.iii.2009 , Col. J.S. Santos” ( RNV ) ( Fig. 3B ).
Dinelytron sp. 2: “UFAMP 01” “ Brasil , AM [Amazonas], Mao [Manaus], Reserva Ducke, v.1985 , N. Hamada Col.” ( UFAM ).

Dinelytron sp. 4: “CEIOC 7641”, “Itatiaia, E. do Rio [state of Rio de Janeiro ], Brasil , 22.1.1927 ”/“Itatiaya [Itatiaia, state of Rio de Janeiro ], 700m , Brasil , 8.xii.1951 , W. Zikan Col.”/“Floresta da Tijuca, Guanabara [ Rio de Janeiro ], Brasil , 22.xi.1961 ” (2 \ MNRJ lost in the burning )/“UFVP01”, “Viçosa, D. D. Alvim Col., x.1946 ”/“UFVP 02”, “Viçosa, MG [ Minas Gerais ], 22.ii.1997 , Lobo. A. P. Col.” (2 \ UFV ) ( Fig. 3A ).

Dinelytron grylloides Gray
\ , Jos. Redtenbacher determ. 1899, public. 1906-08 . Bestimm. Verz. Nr. 382”, “ Rio de Janeiro ”/“PHA 157, Zoologischer Museum Hamburg”, “ Brasilien [ Brazil ] Itatiaia, 700m , 6.xii.1926 ”,/“PHA 156, Zoologischer Museum Hamburg”, “ Brasilien , Itatiaia 700m , eing. 1928”, (4 \ ZMUH - examined by photo).

Remarks . Females could not be associated with males due to three reasons: 1) all of the
Dinelytron
species analyzed were mainly distinguished by the male terminalia and genitalia; 2) diagnostic external morphological characters of the males (e.g. shape of the labrum and clypeus) were not found in the females, even when both sexes were collected in the same area; 3) in some cases, more than one female species were collected at the same location (e.g. Rio de Janeiro , Itatiaia). A safer association can only be achieved through rearing from eggs and molecular analyses.

subSubSection.paragraph: Species included :

Dinelytron agrion
( note : although it is below demonstrated that it does not belong to
Dinelytron
, it is not going to be transferred to another genus in the present work).

Dinelytron grylloides
type-species.

Dinelytron hipponax
incertae sedis .

D. shuckardi
incertae sedis .
